分布：十四(100%)


num.十四,十四个He is fourteen, old enough to take care of himself!他十四岁了,可以照顾自己了!



US [ˌfɔ:r-/ UK ['--] number  ESSENTIAL  ■the number 14 （数位）14
•twelve, thirteen, fourteen, fifteen12，13，14，15

•Her baby is fourteen months old.她的孩子14个月大了。
examples: 英 [ˌfɔː'tiːn] 美 [ˌfɔːr'tiːn]
num.十四
(1) She toured the U.S. when she was fourteen.(2) My younger sister is all but fourteen years old.
(1) 她十四岁时就在美国旅游观光。(2) 我妹妹差不多十四岁了。

translation:
n. 狐; 狐狸; 狡猾的人; 狐皮
vt. 欺骗; 迷惑; 使困惑
vi. 耍花招

时态：foxed, foxing, foxes
分布：狐狸(92%)，欺骗(4%)，狡猾的人(2%)，迷惑(2%)


→来自puk, 尾巴。因狐狸毛茸茸的大尾巴而得名。引申词义欺骗，迷糊，耍花招等。
n.狐狸Her boyfriend fed a box of oxygen and hydrogen to the ox and fox.她男朋友给牛和狐狸喂了一盒子氧和氢.



US [fɑ:ks] noun ANIMAL  动物   ADVANCED  countable ■a wild mammal belonging to the dog family which has a pointed face and ears, a wide tail covered in fur and often reddish-brown fur 狐，狐狸uncountable ■the skin of this animal used to make coats and hats 狐狸皮
UK [fɒks] US [fɑ:ks] noun CLEVER PERSON  聪明的人  countable usually singular ■someone who is clever and good at deceiving people 狡猾的人
•He's a cunning/sly/wily old fox.他是一个狡猾／阴险／诡计多端的老狐狸。

UK [fɒks] US [fɑ:ks] noun WOMAN  女人  countable US informal ■a sexually attractive woman 狐狸精，狐媚子，性感女郎
UK [fɒks] US [fɑ:ks] verb transitive CONFUSE  使迷惑  ■to confuse someone or be too difficult to be understood by someone 使迷惑；难住
•This puzzle has well and truly foxed me!这个谜真把我给难住了！

UK [fɒks] US [fɑ:ks] verb transitive DECEIVE  欺骗  ■to deceive someone in a clever way 欺骗，使上当



vt. 欺骗；使变酸
 - sell, kid
n. [脊椎] 狐狸；狡猾的人
 - renard, serpent
vi. 假装；耍狡猾手段
 - act, make as if
examples: 英 [fɒks] 美 [fɑːks]
n.狐狸；狡猾的人；迷人的时髦女郎vt.欺骗；迷惑

(1) The fox lay dying in a pool of gore.(2) The fox went to ground under a rocky escarpment.(3) He's a crafty old fox.(4) Don't trust him, he is a sly old fox.(5) His meeting with Mr Ma was rescheduled to fox protesters.
(1) 狐狸倒在血泊中奄奄一息。(2) 狐狸钻进了石崖下面的洞里。(3) 他是一只狡猾的老狐狸。(4) 别相信他，他像老狐狸一样狡猾。(5) 他与马先生的会面被重新安排以迷惑抗议者。

translation:
n. [数]分数; 一小部分，些微; 不相连的一块，片段; [化]分馏

时态：fractioned, fractioning, fractions
分布：小部分(49%)，分数(46%)，片段(4%)，少许(1%)


→来自bhreg, 分开，破开，词源同break, fragment. 即破开的部分，少量。
部分;小片,分数(fract+ion)[fract,frang=break,表示"打碎"]
n.碎片,小部分,一点儿;分数In the reaction, the fraction acts as an agent.在反应中,这些碎片起一种媒剂的作用.



noun countable  ADVANCED  ■a number that results from dividing one whole number by another, or a small part of something 分数；小部分
•¼ and 0.25 are different ways of representing the same fraction.1/4和0.25是同一分数的不同表达方式。

•Although sexual and violent crimes have increased by 10%, they remain only a tiny/small  fraction  of the total number of crimes committed each year.尽管性犯罪和暴力犯罪案件增长了10%，但它们在每年的罪案总数中所占比例仍然很小。

•They can produce it at a  fraction  of the cost of (= much more cheaply than) traditional methods.他们能够以大大低于传统方法的成本生产它。





share, fraction, division, segment, part, fragment, section, piece, portion

这组词都有“整体的一部分”的意思，其区别是：
share: 指共有的东西中应占有的一部分。
fraction: 指包含在全体中的一部分，暗示微不足道的一部分。
division: 通常指按类划分或分割成而的部分。常含抽象意义。
segment: 指某物的特定部分或自然形成的部分，也指线形物品的一段。
part: 含义广，最普通用词。常指整体中可大可小的一部分，也可指整体中可分开的独立部分。
fragment: 指因破裂、分割等产生的支离破碎、不规则的一部分。
section: 指整体中的分区，部分与部分之间有显著界限。
piece: 指整体中的一些个体，尤指从某个整体上分出来的一部分。
portion: 侧重从整体中所分配到的那一部分，含一定的独立意义。


n. [数] 分数；部分；小部分；稍微
 - score, marks, proportion, part, portion
examples: 英 ['frækʃn] 美 ['frækʃn]
n.小部分；少许；分数；片段

(1) Mother's careful with her money, and spends only a fraction of her earnings.(2) The door opened a fraction.(3) I can only pay a fraction of my bill.(4) Open the window a fraction, please.(5) One forth is a proper fraction.(6) In the reaction, the fraction acts as an agent.
(1) 母亲用钱很审慎,只花自己收入很小的一部分。(2) 门稍微开了条缝。(3) 我只付我的帐单的一小部分。(4) 请把窗户打一开点。(5) 四分之一是一个真分数。(6) 在反应中,这些碎片起一种媒介的作用。
[sound:youdao-0d76c493-3a96f046-90a262c5-3b8e3f6f-47acd022.mp3]

translation:
n. 碎片; 片段，未完成的部分; （将文件内容）分段
vt. （使）碎裂，破裂，分裂
vi. 破碎，碎裂

时态：fragmented, fragmenting, fragments
分布：片段(67%)，碎片(28%)，分裂(4%)，使破碎(1%)


→来自bhreg, 分开，破开，词源同break, fraction. 即破开的部分，碎片。
碎片;片断(frag+ment表名词)[fract,frang=break,表示"打碎"]
碎片(frag破碎)[-ment 1.表名词"行为或结果"2.表示具体物]
n.碎片,小部分,片断The ragged man drags a waggon of rag fragments.那个衣衫褴褛的人拉着一货车破布碎片.
【记】frag碎【反】coalesce（v 接合；联合）



noun countable /ˈfræg.mənt/■a small piece or a part, especially when broken from something whole 小片，小块；（尤指）碎片，碎块
•The road was covered with fragments of glass from the shattered window.马路上到处是车窗的碎玻璃片。

•Literary scholars are piecing together her last unpublished novel from fragments of a recently discovered manuscript.文学研究者们正在把最近发现的她最后一部未发表小说的手稿残片一点点拼凑起来。

verb intransitive or transitive /frægˈment/■to break something into small parts or to be broken up in this way （使）支离破碎；打碎；（使）分裂
•The satellite will fragment and burn up as it falls through the Earth's atmosphere.卫星坠经地球大气层时会碎裂起火，化为灰烬。

•The government is planning to fragment the industry before privatizing it.政府正计划将该产业拆分后再进行私有化。





bit, scrap, slice, fragment, sheet, piece

这组词都有“片、块、段”的意思，其区别是：
bit: 侧重指微小，一点点，小碎片。
scrap: 侧重指废弃的零碎之物。
slice: 多指切得很薄的一片食物。
fragment: 指破裂的，不完整的，不可完整的碎片。
sheet: 侧重指平整很薄的一张或一片。
piece: 最普通用词，多指从整体上分割下来的东西，可大可小。



share, fraction, division, segment, part, fragment, section, piece, portion

这组词都有“整体的一部分”的意思，其区别是：
share: 指共有的东西中应占有的一部分。
fraction: 指包含在全体中的一部分，暗示微不足道的一部分。
division: 通常指按类划分或分割成而的部分。常含抽象意义。
segment: 指某物的特定部分或自然形成的部分，也指线形物品的一段。
part: 含义广，最普通用词。常指整体中可大可小的一部分，也可指整体中可分开的独立部分。
fragment: 指因破裂、分割等产生的支离破碎、不规则的一部分。
section: 指整体中的分区，部分与部分之间有显著界限。
piece: 指整体中的一些个体，尤指从某个整体上分出来的一部分。
portion: 侧重从整体中所分配到的那一部分，含一定的独立意义。


n. 碎片；片断或不完整部分
 - debris, chip
examples: 英 ['fræɡmənt] 美 ['fræɡmənt]
n.碎片；片段v.使破碎；分裂

(1) She dropped the vase on the floor and it broke into fragments.(2) There's a fragment of glass in the wound.(3) Her hand was cut by a fragment of glass.(4) I overheard a fragment of their conversation.(5) Every fragment in perpetuity is instantaneous.(6) These bullets fragment on impact.(7) The vase was fragmented in shipment.(8) The chair fragmented under his weight.(9) Ownership of the large estates is increasingly fragmented.
(1) 她把花瓶掉在地上，摔成了碎片。(2) 伤口内有玻璃碎片。(3) 她的手被一块玻璃碎片划破了。(4) 我无意中听到他们谈话的片段。(5) 在这个永恒中任何片段有仅仅是那么一瞬(6) 这些子弹射中物体时爆炸成碎片。(7) 花瓶在运送途中被打碎了。(8) 在他重压下，椅子断了。(9) 这一大笔地产的所有权逐渐地四分五裂了。
[sound:youdao-211db65f-4b91e794-9c99e01d-76fa06b8-294d21b7.mp3]

translation:
n. 框架; 眼镜框; 组织; 边框
vt. 陷害; 设计; 表达; 使适合（某一特殊用途）
adj. 有木架的，有构架的

时态：framed, framing, frames
分布：框(59%)，帧(19%)，结构(11%)，陷害(3%)，骨架(3%)，制定(2%)，身躯(1%)，表达(1%)，把 ... 框起来(1%)


→来自pro, 向前，词源同forth, from, proceed. 其原义为向前，推进，用来指建筑框架和基础结构。后词义通用化。
n.框架;体格;骨架;组织;机构v.设计;制定The tame tigers play the same game on the frame.温顺的老虎在框架上玩同一游戏.



noun countable BORDER  边界   ADVANCED  ■a border which surrounds and supports a picture, door or window （图画、门、窗的）框，框架
•a picture frame画框
frames ■the plastic or metal structure that holds together a pair of glasses 眼镜框架
[freɪm] noun countable STRUCTURE  结构   ADVANCED  ■the basic structure of a building, vehicle or piece of furniture that other parts are added onto （建筑物、车辆或家俱的）构架，支架，骨架
•a bicycle frame脚踏车车架
■UK (US rack) ■a wooden or plastic triangular object used to put the balls into position at the start of a game such as billiards or snooker （桌球、撞球等运动中开球时使用的）三角框■the size and shape of someone's body 体格；骨架
•My sister has a much bigger frame than me.我姐姐的骨架比我大很多。
frame of mind ■the way someone thinks or feels about something at a particular time 心态，心境
•The most important thing is to go into the exam in a positive frame of mind.最重要的是要以积极的心态参加考试。
frame of reference ■a set of ideas or facts accepted by a person which explains their behaviour, opinions or decisions （某人的行为、看法或决定所依据的）参照准则，观念体系
•How can Christians and atheists ever come to understand each other when their frames of reference are so different?基督徒和无神论者的思想观念差异如此之大，他们又怎么能相互理解呢？

[freɪm] noun countable GAME  游戏  ■a period of play in some games, such as snooker （桌球等游戏的）一局
•She lost the next two frames.她输掉了接下来的两局。

[freɪm] noun countable PHOTOGRAPH  相片  specialized■one of the pictures on a strip of photographic film, or one of the single pictures which together form a television or cinema film （摄影胶片的）画格；（电视或电影的）画面，镜头
[freɪm] verb EXPRESS  表达  transitive ■to express something choosing your words carefully （措词谨慎地）表达，说出
•The interview would have been more productive if the questions had been framed more precisely.如果当时问题提得更确切些，采访就会更有成效。

[freɪm] verb MAKE GUILTY  使有罪  transitive often passive informal ■to make a person seem to be guilty of a crime when they are not, by producing facts or information which are not true 陷害，诬陷
•He claimed he'd been framed by the police.他声称自己被警方陷害了。

[freɪm] verb BORDER  边界  transitive ■to fix a border around a picture etc. and often glass in front of it 给（图画等）装（镜）框
•I keep meaning to get that photo framed.我一直打算给那张相片镶上框。
transitive ■to form an edge to something in an attractive way 修饰…的边缘
•Her new hairstyle frames her face in a much more flattering way.她的新发型把脸衬托得漂亮多了。




n. [建]  [计] 框架；结构； [电影] 画面
 - configuration, mechanics, texture, structure
vt. 设计；建造；陷害；使…适合
 - design, construct, engineer, style, project
examples: 英 [freɪm] 美 [freɪm]
n.骨架；身躯；结构；框；帧v.表达；制定；把 ... 框起来；陷害

(1) She is having a lean, gaunt frame with prominent bones.(2) Sobs shook her slender frame.(3) This athlete has a powerful frame.(4) It gives the frame of DFL programming language.(5) In a silver frame on the table there is a photograph of her husband.(6) You can either move or resize the text frame, or move the picture frame so there is no overlap.(7) His lips could hardly frame the words.(8) An examiner must frame his question clearly.(9) The government is framing a new bill to control gambling.(10) We must frame up that picture.(11) He was willing to die just to frame you?

(1) 他骨瘦如柴的身材又细又瘦,骨骼突出的(2) 她抽泣著，苗条的身体都在颤动。(3) 这位运动员有着魁梧的体格。(4) 提出了DFL程序设计语言的基本框架结构。(5) 在桌上的银相框里有张她丈夫的照片。(6) 您可以移动文本框或调整文本框的尺寸,或者移动图片框以消除重叠。(7) 他几乎说不出话来。(8) 主考人必须清楚地提出他的问题。(9) 政府在制定新的法案以控制赌博。(10) 我们必须给那幅画装上框。(11) 为了陷害你而情愿死?
[sound:youdao-14fe0140-e2782443-d64ce48a-cf70124d-be1315b4.mp3]

translation:
n. 构架; 框架; （体系的）结构; 机构，组织

分布：框架(88%)，结构(9%)，体系(3%)


n.构架;框架;结构;组织;机构This bridge over the river has a steel framework.这座跨江大桥是钢骨结构.



US [-wɝ:k] noun  ADVANCED  countable ■a supporting structure around which something can be built （建筑物等的）架构，框架 ADVANCED  ■a system of rules, ideas or beliefs that is used to plan or decide something （规则、观念或信仰的）框架，体系，结构
•a legal framework for resolving disputes解决争端的法律体系




n. 框架，骨架；结构， [建] 构架
 - configuration, mechanics, texture, structure
examples: 英 ['freɪmwɜːk] 美 ['freɪmwɜːrk]
n.框架；体系；结构
(1) Government is the one who establishes national policy framework.(2) It's a bridge of steel framework.(3) All the cases can be considered within the framework of the existing rules.
(1) 国家政策体系的是由政府建立的。(2) 那是座钢铁结构的桥梁。(3) 一切情况都可依据现行章程的结构加以考虑。
[sound:youdao-478d5b5c-3361b8fc-e030fd91-c853bbbf-74668ffc.mp3]

translation:
adj. 坦白的，直率的; 清楚表明的; 明显的
n. 弗兰克; 免费邮寄权; 免费邮戳或签名; 免费邮寄的信件
vt. 免费寄（邮件）; 盖免费邮寄公章; 盖邮戳; 便于使（人）自由地来往

时态：franked, franking, franks
分布：坦白的(38%)，直率的(33%)，免费邮寄(16%)，真诚的(10%)，使自由出入(3%)


→来自Frank, 法兰克人，部落名。在公元五世纪，整个西欧仍处在一种野蛮的部落时代，整个社会被分成自由人，俘虏，和奴隶三个等级，而Frank人做为战胜级，享受唯一的自由权。后部落名通用化，赋予诸多美好的词义，如自由的，高贵的，美丽的，优雅的，大方的，真诚的等。后主要用于坦率的，其它词义逐渐废弃。参照电影《庞贝末日》。Frank 法兰克人
a.坦白的,直率的The frank man put the first-rank blank blanket into the tan tank.直率的男子将一流空白毛毯放进黝黑的大容器
【参】blank（adj 空白的；没有表情的n 空白）都源于：ank表示“白”



adjective ■honest, sincere and telling the truth, even when this might be awkward or make other people uncomfortable 坦率的，坦诚的；直言不讳的
•a full and frank discussion全面而坦诚的讨论

•There followed a frank exchange of views.接下来大家坦诚地交换了意见。

•The magazine, which gives frank advice about sex and romance, is aimed at the teenage market.这本杂志面向青少年市场，对性和恋爱问题作出坦率的忠告。

•To be perfectly frank with you, I don't think she's the woman for the job.十分坦诚地告诉你，我认为她不适合做那份工作。

[fræŋk] verb transitive ■to print a mark on a stamp so that the stamp cannot be used again, or to print a mark on an envelope to show that the cost of sending it has been paid 在（邮票）上盖戳；在（信封）上盖戳表示邮资已付




open, frank, sincere, blunt, honest, plain, straightforward

这组词都有“坦率，诚实”的意思，其区别是：
open: 指不隐瞒自己的秘密，愿意向他人表露自己或公开暴露自己的缺点。
frank: 强调毫无保留地畅所欲言，不受任何约束。
sincere: 侧重指一个人出自内心地对某人某事表示一种诚意。
blunt: 指讲话坦白直率、不客气，但隐含不得体、不顾及他人感情等意味。
honest: 指遵守正直等道德准则。
plain: 指直言不讳，毫不做作或故弄玄虚。
straightforward: 多用于答复、叙述等场合。指直截了当，不回避，或故弄玄虚。


adj. 坦白的，直率的；老实的
 - explicit, naked, confessed
examples: 英 [fræŋk] 美 [fræŋk]
adj.坦白的；直率的；真诚的vt.免费邮寄；使自由出入n.免费邮寄；弗兰克（人名）

(1) A frank discussion can help to clear the air.(2) To be very frank, I think you have very little chance of getting the job.(3) He was frank, open and aboveboard.(4) They tend to be frank and open but alo self-centered and willful.(5) He offered a frank apology to her for hurting her feelings.(6) We are trying to frank him through customs.
(1) 坦率的谈论有助于消除疑虑。(2) 坦白地说，我认为你获得这项工作的机会微乎其微。(3) 他胸怀坦白，光明磊落。(4) 他们的性格坦诚、直率，但往往以自我为中心，并且任性妄为。(5) 他因伤害了她的感情而真诚地向她道歉。(6) 我们正努力使他免检通过海关。
[sound:youdao-d4e83d97-92c16b51-fb5a4f27-4bbe104d-0ec43e79.mp3]

translation:
adv. 自由地，随意地，免费地; 直率地; 免费地; 慷慨地

分布：自由地(34%)，大量地(22%)，免费地(22%)，直率地(22%)


adverb NOT LIMITED  不受限制地   ADVANCED  ■without being controlled or limited 自由地；不受控制地；不受限制地
•For the first time in months she could move freely.数月以来她第一次可以自由走动。

•Exotic foods are freely available in supermarkets.超市里随时可以买到来自外国的食品。

•She freely (= willingly) admits that she's not as fast a runner as she used to be.她爽快地承认不如以前跑得快了。

•We encourage the victims to talk freely (= talk a lot and honestly) about their experiences.我们鼓励受害者坦率讲出他们的经历。

['fri:.li] adverb ABLE TO MOVE EASILY  可轻易移动  ■in a way which is not fixed or joined to anything, so able to move easily 可轻易移动地
•Remember to apply plenty of oil so that the wheel can rotate freely.记住上足油，这样轮子才转得顺。




adv. 自由地；免费地；大量地；慷慨地；直率地
 - largely, importantly, big, heavy
examples: 英 ['friːli] 美 ['friːli]
adv.自由地；免费地；直率地；大量地

(1) The Woodstock generation attempted to swing freely.(2) Love is freely given, not doled out on demand.(3) I freely admit the former existence of many islands, now buried beneath the sea, which may have served as haltingplaces for plants and for many animals during their migration.
(1) 伍德斯托克一代试图自由地赶时髦。(2) 爱是自由地给予，爱不是在需要的时候施舍。(3) 我直率地承认，从前曾存在过许多岛屿可作为植物和许多动物迁移中歇足之地，现在都已埋在海下了。

translation:
vt. 使结冰，使冻僵; 冷藏; 吓呆; 冻结（存款，工资等）
vi. 凝固，结冰; 冻伤，冻死
n. 冻结; 严寒时期

时态：froze, frozen, freezing, freezes
分布：冻结(72%)，冷冻(22%)，凝固(3%)，严寒(2%)，僵硬(1%)


→来自preus, 冷，冰冻，发烧，词源同frost, prurient. 这种看似矛盾的词义比较calm，或感冒发烧，长冻疮等的病症。
v.使结冰,使凝固In the freezing breeze, the breeder greedily squeezed oil from the seeds.在冰冷的微风中,饲养员贪婪地从种子中榨油.



verb (froze, frozen)COLD  冷   IMPROVER  intransitive or transitive ■If you freeze something, you lower its temperature below 0°C, causing it to become cold and often hard, and if something freezes, its temperature goes below 0°C （使）冻结，（使）结冰
•Water freezes to ice at a temperature of 0°C.水在摄氏零度结冰。

•The ground had frozen hard/solid.地面已经冻得硬邦邦的了。

•When the lake freezes (over) (= turns into ice on the surface) , we can go skating on it.湖面结冰后，我们可以在上面滑冰。

•Our pipes froze (up) (= the water in them turned to ice) several times last winter.去年冬天我们的水管冻了好几次。

•The weather forecast says that it is going to freeze tonight (= that the temperature will be at or below 0°C).天气预报说今晚温度会至冰点或更低。

•Without a sleeping bag, you would freeze to death (= become so cold that you die) out there on the mountainside.在山坡那里，没有睡袋你会被冻死。
 IMPROVER  intransitive or transitive ■to preserve food by storing it at a very low temperature so that it becomes hard 冷冻保存（食物）
•I'll freeze any food that's left over.我会把剩下的食物都冷冻起来。

•Most soups freeze (= can be preserved by being stored at a very low temperature) well.大多数汤都可以冷冻保存。

[fri:z] verb (froze, frozen)STOP WORKING  停止工作  intransitive US (also freeze up) ■If an engine or lock freezes, it stops working because its parts have become stuck and can no longer move （引擎或锁）卡住，堵塞
•My old bicycle was so rusty that the gears had frozen.我的旧自行车锈得太厉害，齿轮都卡住不动了。

•If the lock has frozen up, try lubricating it with oil.如果锁卡住了，上点油润滑一下试试。

[fri:z] verb (froze, frozen)STOP MOVING  停止移动  intransitive ■If a person or animal that is moving freezes, it stops suddenly and becomes completely still, especially because of fear （尤指出于恐惧）僵住，呆住
•She saw someone outside the window and froze.她看见窗外有人，一下就呆住了。

•"Freeze (= Don't move) or I'll shoot", screamed the gunman.“不许动，否则我就开枪了！”那个持枪者大喊道。

[fri:z] verb (froze, frozen)MONEY/PROPERTY  资金／财产  transitive ■To freeze something such as pay or prices is to fix them at a particular level and not allow any increases 使（工资、物价等）固定不变，阻止…增长
•The Government has frozen pensions until the end of next year.政府已决定在明年年底之前维持养老金水准不变。
transitive ■to officially and legally prevent money or property from being used or moved 冻结（资金或财产）
•When it was obvious the company was going bankrupt, the government ordered all their assets to be frozen.当该公司很明显要破产倒闭时，政府下令冻结其全部资产。

[fri:z] verb (froze, frozen)be cold enough to freeze the balls off a brass monkey humorous ■to be very cold 冷得要命
[fri:z] verb (froze, frozen)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] freeze sb out ■to make someone feel that they are not part of a group by being unfriendly towards them, or to stop someone from being included in an arrangement or activity 排挤，排斥（某人）
•I felt I was being frozen out of/from the discussions.我感觉他们在排挤我，不让我参加讨论。

•He believed that organizations like theirs were being frozen out.他认为他们那一类的组织被排除在外了。

[fri:z] noun COLD WEATHER  寒冷天气  only singular ■a period of extremely cold weather 严寒期，冰冻期
[fri:z] noun STOP  停止  countable ■a temporary stopping of something （暂时的）冻结，停滞
•The Government has imposed a wage freeze/a freeze on wage increases.政府暂时冻结了工资增长。




vi. [物] 冻结；冷冻；僵硬
 - rigidize
n. [物] 冻结；凝固
 - solidification, coagulation
examples: 英 [friːz] 美 [friːz]
v.冻结；冷冻；僵硬；凝固n.严寒；冻结

(1) Water freezes at the temperature of 0 degrees Celsius.(2) We ate some of the fruits and froze the rest.(3) They freeze this theory to death.(4) The quality of the imagination is to flow and not to freeze.(5) The freeze caused many problems in the small town.(6) The government has introduced a wage freeze.
(1) 水在摄氏零度结冰。(2) 我们吃了一些水果，把剩下的冷藏起来。(3) 他们把这个理论僵化了。(4) 想象的特点是流动,而不是凝固。(5) 严寒冰冻给这座小镇带来许多麻烦。(6) 政府已宣布要冻结工资。
[sound:youdao-05a71bb1-c920f6a5-deae292c-1c653794-b8eb15c0.mp3]

translation:
n. 货运，货物; 运费; 船运货物; 货运列车
vt. 运输; 装货于

时态：freighted, freighting, freights
分布：货运(59%)，货物(34%)，运送(6%)，装货于(1%)


→来自Proto-Germanic*fra-aigan, *fra, 整个的，*aigan, 拥有，所有，词源同own.即所有物，装上船的，发货的。其原义仅指水运或船运，后词义通用化。
n.货物,货运,运费My neighbor knows the height and weight of the highjacked freight.我邻居知道被劫持货船的高度和重量.



noun uncountable ■goods, but not passengers, that are carried from one place to another, by ship, aircraft, train or truck, or the system of transporting these goods 货物；货运
•The ship carries both freight and passengers.这艘船既载货又载客。

•a freight company货运公司

•Will the goods be sent by air or sea freight?这些货物要空运还是海运？

•freight trains货运列车

•US The escaped prisoner made his getaway in a freight car/wagon on a train.逃犯躲在火车的载货车厢里逃脱了。
■the money paid for transporting goods 运费
[freɪt] verb transitive ■to send goods by air, sea or train 运送（货物）
•Grapes from this region are freighted all over the world.这个地区生产的葡萄被运到世界各地。

[freɪt] adverb ■transported as part of a large group of things, by ship, aircraft, train or truck 货物；货运
•It would be much cheaper to send the goods freight.把货物集中发运会便宜得多。





commodity, merchandise, ware, freight, goods

这组词都有“商品，货物”的意思，其区别是：
commodity: 作“商品”解时系经济学名词，也可指日用品。
merchandise: 正式用词，指商业上销售或商家拥有货物的总称。
ware: 指上市待卖的商品或货物。多用复数形式。
freight: 指“货物”时，可与goods互换，此系美国英语。在英国，freight志指船装货物。
goods: 一般生活或商业用词，指销售或购入的商品。


vt. 运送；装货；使充满
 - ship, transit, forward
n. 货运； [交] 运费； [水运] 船货
 - charges, carriage
examples: 英 [freɪt] 美 [freɪt]
n.（货运）运费；货运；货物vt.装货于；运送

(1) At an auction, the buyer pays the freight.(2) The freight must be added to the cost of the goods.(3) We can send it by air/sea freight.(4) Eight thousand tons of freight were being landed each day.(5) They freighted the boat with bananas.(6) You can freight your belongings by air or sea.(7) We freight goods to all parts of America.
(1) 在拍卖会上，买家支付运费。(2) 运费必须打入货的成本。(3) 我们可以空运[海运]。(4) 每天卸货8000吨上岸。(5) 他们把香蕉装上船。(6) 你可把东西经空运或海运运去。(7) 我们将货物发往全美各地。

noun uncountable  ESSENTIAL  ■the language that people speak in France, Belgium, parts of Canada and other countries 法语the French  ESSENTIAL  [plural] ■the people of France 法国人

•That sod Wilkins, excuse my French, has taken my bloody parking space.该死的威尔金斯——不好意思讲了粗口——他妈的占了我的停车位。

[frentʃ] adjective  IMPROVER  ■from, belonging to or relating to France 法国的；与法国有关的

[frentʃ] adjective ■relating to France or to the French language 法国的，法语的

Others/Some can speak French.(4) I've only recently started learning French.(5) This student is good at French.(6) They assumed I was French from my surname.(7) Do you like French films?(8) It 's one of the best French restaurants in Boston.(9) The French paper was set by our form teacher.(10) He knows a few French words.

translation:
n. 频繁性; [数][物]频率，次数; 频率分布

分布：频率(95%)，频繁(5%)


→来自frequent, 频繁的。用于语音学名词。
n.频率,周率This radio station broadcasts on three different frequencies.这家电台用三种不同的周率广播.
【反】rarity（n 稀有）



noun HAPPENING  发生  countable or uncountable ■the number of times something happens within a particular period, or the fact of something happening often or a large number or times （事件发生的）频度，次数；频繁
•Complaints about the frequency of trains rose by 201% in the last year.去年对火车发车频率的投诉增长了201%。

•the increasing frequency of terrorist attacks越来越频繁的恐怖袭击

•It's not the duration of his absences from work so much as the frequency that worries me.与他的旷工时日相比，他旷工的频繁程度更让我担忧。

['fri:.kwənt.si] noun LIGHT/SOUND/RADIO, ETC  光／声音／电波  uncountable specialized ■the number of times that a wave, especially a sound or radio wave, is produced within a particular period, especially one second （尤指声波或无线电波每秒振动的）频率
•the frequency of light光的频率

•low frequency radiation低频辐射

•The human ear cannot hear very high-frequency sounds.人耳听不到极高频率的声音。
countable specialized ■a particular number of radio waves produced in a second at which a radio signal is broadcast 频率（无线电信号的每秒电波数）
•Do you know what frequency the BBC World Service is on ?你知道英国广播公司的广播频率是多少吗？




n. [物] 频率；频繁
 - periodicity
examples: 英 ['friːkwənsi] 美 ['friːkwənsi]
n.频繁；频率

(1) Accidents on that highway are happening with increasing frequency.(2) Accidents are happening with increasing frequency.(3) He wrote to both with tolerable frequency.(4) He varied the transmission frequency.(5) He tuned his radio to the police frequency.(6) The pitch depends on the frequency.(7) We can often correlate age with frequency of illness.
(1) 那条高速公路上车祸发生得越来越频繁。(2) 事故正在愈加频繁地发生。(3) 他和他们通信，相当频繁。(4) 他变换了无线电传送的频率。(5) 他把无线电调到警方的频率。(6) 音调的高低是由频率决定的。(7) 年龄的大小往往与发病率有关。

translation:
adj. 频繁的，时常发生的，常见的; （脉搏等）急促的，快的

时态：frequented, frequenting, frequents
分布：频繁的(58%)，常去(21%)，常到(11%)，经常的(10%)


→来自拉丁语frequens, 反复的，拥挤的，硬塞的。可能来自ger, 围，转，包围，词源同cram, crowd, group.
a.时常发生的,频繁的Subsequently the eloquent man frequently asked the consequence of quenching in sequence.其后雄辩者频繁地询问顺序灭火的结果.
【反】visit rarely（很少拜访）；shun『avoid』有争议：shun侧重故意避开危险、真理、社交等＝avoid deliberately；avoid可指避开任何东西，人，事。它们的区别就在于deliberately，但是没有字典指出frequent是否有故意的含义。但是我会选avoid，有例句表明avoid可以用来避免一个地方。（仅供参考）



US [ˈfriː.kwənt] formal ■to be in or visit a particular place often 常去，常到（某处）
•a bar frequented by criminals犯罪分子经常光顾的酒吧





constant, continual, consist, frequent

constant: 恒久不变的
continual: 多次重复的，不间断的
consist: 由…组成
frequent: 日常的，频繁的


adj. 频繁的；时常发生的；惯常的
 - confirmed, continual
vt. 常到，常去；时常出入于
 - resort to
examples: 英 ['friːkwənt] 美 ['friːkwənt]
adj.频繁的；经常的vt.常到；常去

(1) My girlfriend writes frequent letters to me.(2) Traffic accidents are alarmingly frequent of late.(3) He is a frequent visitor to our house.(4) He suffers from frequent bouts of depression.(5) His frequent hesitations annoyed the audience.(6) He used to frequent the town's bars and night-clubs.(7) The police visited all the bars that the suspect frequented.(8) These woods are frequented by all kinds of birds.
(1) 我的女朋友频繁地给我写信。(2) 近来交通事故频繁得吓人。(3) 他是我们家的常客。(4) 他患多发性抑郁症。(5) 他三番五次欲言又止，听众已感到厌烦。(6) 他从前常去镇上的酒吧和夜总会。(7) 警察调查了嫌疑犯时常出没的所有酒吧。(8) 这些树林里经常栖息着各种鸟类。
[sound:youdao-fea3ca12-cb001665-c1715da8-7089cd38-133bc1da.mp3]

translation:
adv. 频繁地，屡次地; 往往; 动; 动辄

分布：频繁地(60%)，经常地(40%)


adverb  ESSENTIAL  ■often 频繁地，经常地
•frequently asked questions经常问到的问题

•I see him quite frequently.我和他见面非常频繁。

•The buses run less frequently on Sundays.周日公车班次间隔时间较长。





regularly, often, usually, repeatedly, always, frequently

这些副词均表示频度。
regularly: 用于修饰经常而有规律性的动作。
often: 经常，语气弱于always,侧重动作发生的次数具有经常性，具体时间意味不强。
usually: 通常，通例地，指习惯性动作，频度仅次于always，较often大，偶尔有间隔。
repeatedly: 屡次，强调次数多，但反复的频率不一定均匀。
always: 总是，永远。语气最强，指在一切时候，没有例外。
frequently: 时常，经常，与often同义，可通用，但较正式，强调次数频繁。


adv. 频繁地，经常地；时常，屡次
 - continually, regular
examples: 英 ['friːkwəntli] 美 ['friːkwəntli]
adv.频繁地；经常地

(1) Buses run frequently from the city to the airport.(2) The bicyclists must be hydrated frequently.(3) His speech was frequently interrupted by stormy applause.(4) He comes to visit me frequently.(5) Stores of grain are frequently attacked by pests.(6) The area is flooded, as frequently happens during the typhoon.(7) My judgement was frequently faulty, but my loyalty to the nation could not be questioned.
(1) 公共汽车频繁地从城市驶往机场。(2) 自行车运动员必须频繁地喝水。(3) 他的演说不时被暴风雨般的掌声打断。(4) 他经常来看我。(5) 储存的谷物经常受到害虫的破坏。(6) 这个地区淹了水，这是台风时经常发生的。(7) 我的判断经常出错，但是我对祖国的忠诚是无可置疑的。
[sound:youdao-fbd858fd-d30c473c-9792f2bf-7e805123-bcc2ffae.mp3]

translation:
adj. 新鲜的; 淡水的; 新的; 无经验的
adv. 刚; 最新的
n. 开始; 新生; 泛滥; 淡水流

级别：fresher, freshest
分布：新鲜的(71%)，清新的(12%)，无经验的(10%)，新近的(4%)，最近地(3%)


→来自preisk, 新鲜的，有活力的，进一步来自preu, 蹦，跳，词源同frog, frolic. 并由此引申诸多词义。
a.新鲜的,无经验的The fresh flesh on the mesh refreshed the dog.网格上的新鲜肉使狗恢复了体力.



adjective NEW  新的   ESSENTIAL  [before noun] ■new; different or another 新的；不同的；另外的
•The original orders were cancelled and I was given fresh instructions.原来的命令撤销了，我又接到了新的指令。

•Fresh evidence has emerged that casts doubts on the men's conviction.出现了新的证据，对这些人的定罪出现了疑点。

•We need to take a fresh look at the problem.我们需要重新看待该问题。

•Your coffee is cold - let me make you a fresh cup.你的咖啡凉了——我给你冲一杯新的吧。

•There has been fresh fighting between police and demonstrators.警方和示威者又发生了冲突。

•They decided to move abroad and make a  fresh start.他们决定移民海外，从头开始。
 ESSENTIAL  [before noun] approving ■new and therefore interesting or exciting 新颖有趣的
•His book offers some fresh insights into the events leading up to the war.他的书就导致那场战争的事件提出了一些新颖的见解。

•We have tried to come up with a fresh new approach.我们试图找到一种新颖的方法。

[freʃ] adjective RECENT  最近的   ADVANCED  ■recently made, done, arrived, etc., and especially not yet changed by time 新近的；新做的；新到的
•There was a fresh fall of snow during the night.晚上刚下了一场雪。

•There's nothing better than fresh bread, straight from the oven.再也没有甚么比刚出炉的新鲜面包更好的了。

•The house, with its fresh coat of paint, looked lovely in the sunshine.这所房子刚刷过漆，在阳光下显得很漂亮。

•She's fresh out of/from university and very bright.她刚刚大学毕业，人很聪明。

•The events of last year are still fresh in people's minds (= people can remember them easily).人们对去年发生的一些事仍记忆犹新。
be fresh out mainly US ■If you are fresh out of something, you have just finished or sold all of it, so that there is no more left. 刚用完；刚卖光
[freʃ] adjective NATURAL  自然的   ADVANCED  ■(of food or flowers) in a natural condition rather than artificially preserved by a process such as freezing （食物或花）新鲜的，非冷冻的
•fresh fruit and vegetables新鲜水果和蔬菜

•fresh fish/meat鲜鱼／肉

•fresh coffee新煮的咖啡

[freʃ] adjective AIR  空气  ■(of air) clean and cool; found outside rather than in a room （空气）清新的，新鲜的
•I opened the window to let some fresh air in.我打开窗子放进一些新鲜空气。

•fresh mountain air山里的新鲜空气

•I'm just going out for a breath of fresh air.我正要出去呼吸新鲜空气。
■describes weather that is cool and sometimes windy （天气）凉爽的，清凉的
•It was a lovely fresh spring morning.这是一个凉爽宜人的春天的早晨。

•There's quite a fresh breeze today.今天风不小，有些凉意。

[freʃ] adjective CLEAN  清洁的  ■clean and pleasant 洁净的；清爽宜人的
•I felt wonderfully clean and fresh after my shower.洗完澡后我感到非常清爽舒适。

•I use a mouthwash to keep my breath fresh.我用漱口水保持口气清新。

•This wine has a light, fresh taste.这种葡萄酒味道清淡爽口。

[freʃ] adjective NOT TIRED  不累的  [after verb] ■energetic and enthusiastic; not tired 精力充沛的；精神饱满的
•I'll deal with this problem in the morning when I'm fresh.我会在上午精力充沛的时候处理这一问题。

•Try and get some sleep on the plane, then you'll arrive feeling fresh.尽量在飞机上睡一会儿，到达时就会有精神。

[freʃ] adjective SKIN  皮肤  ■(of a face) natural, healthy and young looking （面部）容光焕发的，充满青春活力的
•She has a lovely fresh (= clear and smooth) complexion.她气色很好，皮肤光洁。

[freʃ] adjective NOT SALTY  不咸的  [before noun] ■(of water) not salty （水）淡的，无盐的
•Trout are fresh water fish (= live in water that is not salty).鳟鱼是淡水鱼。

•These plants are found in fresh water lakes and rivers (= those containing water that is not salty).这些植物生长在淡水河湖里。

[freʃ] adjective TOO CONFIDENT  过于自信的  informal ■being too confident and showing no respect, or showing by your actions or words that you want to have sex with someone 自以为是的，放肆无礼的；（对异性）轻佻放肆的
•Don't you get fresh with me, young woman!别勾引我，姑娘！

•He started getting fresh (= behaving in a sexual way) in the cinema, so she slapped his face.在戏院里他就对她动手动脚，所以她打了他一耳光。

[freʃ] adjective be as fresh as a daisy ■to be full of energy and enthusiasm 精神饱满
•After a good night's sleep I'll be as fresh as a daisy.好好睡上一觉后我就会精神焕发。





new, fresh, original, innovative, novel

这组词都有“新的”的意思，其区别是：
new: 普通用词，与old相对，指最近的或创新的。
fresh: 指新鲜的、新做的，侧重创新。
original: 强调独创性。
innovative: 强调富有创新和革新精神。
novel: 侧重新事物的新奇和独特。


adj. 新鲜的；清新的； [水文] 淡水的；无经验的
 - new, raw
n. 开始；新生；泛滥
 - beginning, threshold, opening, conception, start
adv. 刚刚，才；最新地
 - hardly, just
examples: 英 [freʃ] 美 [freʃ]
adj.新鲜的；清新的；新近的；无经验的adv.最近地

(1) Some tribes migrate with their cattle in search of fresh grass.(2) Open the window and let in some fresh air.(3) When fresh supplies come into the market, we can revert to your enquiry.(4) I feel really fresh after my holiday.(5) There was no sense in courting fate with a new, able, and psychologically fresh group.
(1) 有些部落为了寻找新鲜的牧草而带着他们的牲畜迁移。(2) 打开窗户，让新鲜的空气进来。(3) 等新货上市时，我们才能回头考虑你们的询盘。(4) 我度假之後真觉得又精神饱满了。(5) 把命运同一批能干的、但心理上无经验的新人拴在一起是没有什么意思的。
[sound:youdao-8b72cf04-be22873b-e7536f66-560d7fab-27f91c71.mp3]

translation:
n. 摩擦; 冲突，不和; 摩擦力

分布：摩擦(82%)，摩擦力(17%)，分歧(1%)


→来自bher, 磨擦，转，词源同bore. -ct, 过去分词后缀。
n.磨擦,摩擦力The compact faction fractured because of friction.紧密小宗派由于摩擦破裂了.
【记】fiction（n 虚构；小说）描写人物friction



noun uncountable FORCE  作用力  ■the force which makes it difficult for one object to slide along the surface of another or to move through a liquid or gas 摩擦力；摩擦
•When you rub your hands together the friction produces heat.揉搓双手时，摩擦会产生热量。

['frɪk.ʃən] noun uncountable DISAGREEMENT  分歧  ■disagreement or unfriendliness caused by people having different opinions （观点不同者之间的）摩擦，不和
•There's a lot of friction between my wife and my mother.我妻子和我母亲之间有很多龃龉。

•Politics is a source of considerable friction in our family.政治问题在我们家是矛盾的一大根源。

•Border clashes have led to increased friction between the two countries.边境冲突引发了两国间更大的摩擦。




n. [力] 摩擦，摩擦力
 - attrition, frottage
examples: [联想] fiction虚构谎言 会引起 friction摩擦争执fraction分数、部分、成分fiction虚构、谎言、编造的事fracture    vt.& vi.（使）折断，破碎   n.破裂，断裂；骨折
英 ['frɪkʃn] 美 ['frɪkʃn]
n.摩擦；摩擦力；分歧

(1) Constant friction wore out the heels of my shoes.(2) Matches are lighted by friction.(3) Friction lowers the efficiency of a machine.(4) Friction causes a rolling ball to stop finally.(5) Without friction, the brake would not work.(6) I oiled the machine to reduce friction.(7) My daughter and son always have frictions.(8) There is some friction among the family members.
(1) 不断的摩擦磨损了我的鞋跟。(2) 火柴由摩擦而生火。(3) 摩擦减低机器的效率。(4) 摩擦力使滚动的球最终停了下来。(5) 如果没有摩擦力,制动器就不能制动。(6) 我把机器上油,以减少摩擦力。(7) 我女儿和儿子总发生矛盾。(8) 家庭成员间有些摩擦。
[sound:youdao-27e3151f-3e93bc89-480c5594-9fc8eae3-3faf8751.mp3]

→缩写自refrigerator.
n.(refrigerator的略语)冰箱Please get me an ice cube out of the fridge.请替我从冰箱里拿块冰块来.



noun countable (also refrigerator) (US old-fashioned ice-box)  ADVANCED  ■a piece of kitchen equipment which uses electricity to preserve food at a cold temperature 冰箱，电冰箱
•Don't forget to put the milk back in the fridge.别忘了把牛奶放回冰箱里。

n.电冰箱
